CatDescriptText: Mrs. John H. Carter, 129 Gormely Avenue, Oakdale, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I think that the Pirates have talked themselves into a slump.  They would be better if they had not allowed themselves to be talked into the slump by what people say.  They should forget what is said and go out to win..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. John H. Carter, wearing dark graphic floral dress and light colored button down sweater, holding handbag, standing in front of light colored wall, left store window displaying female mannequin wearing light colored sleeveless polka dot dress with dark sheer overlay, store window on right displaying men's dress shoes with sign inscribed "...Custom Tips..."
